intro: Pyrus communis f. serotina, commonly known as the late-blooming pear. This is a cultivar of the common pear, characterized by its delayed flowering compared to other varieties. It typically produces small, yellowish-green fruits that ripen later in the season. The plant retains the typical morphology of the common pear, with a spreading canopy and edible fruit. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental qualities and extended fruiting period.
